column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#Text=CHAPTER
#Text=II
#Text=The next day was splendid , as Felix had prophesied ; if the winter had suddenly leaped into spring , the spring had for the moment as quickly leaped into summer .
#Text=This was an observation made by a young girl who came out of a large square house in the country , and strolled about in the spacious garden which separated it from a muddy road .

#Text=The flowering shrubs and the neatly-disposed plants were basking in the abundant light and warmth ; the transparent shade of the great elms -- they were magnificent trees -- seemed to thicken by the hour ; and the intensely habitual stillness offered a submissive medium to the sound of a distant church-bell .
#Text=The young girl listened to the church-bell ; but she was not dressed for church .
#Text=She was bare-headed ; she wore a white muslin waist , with an embroidered border , and the skirt of her dress was of colored muslin .

#Text=She was a young lady of some two or three and twenty years of age , and though a young person of her sex walking bare-headed in a garden , of a Sunday morning in spring-time , can , in the nature of things , never be a displeasing object , you would not have pronounced this innocent Sabbath-breaker especially pretty .

#Text=She was tall and pale , thin and a little awkward ; her hair was fair and perfectly straight ; her eyes were dark , and they had the singularity of seeming at once dull and restless -- differing herein , as you see , fatally from the ideal “ fine eyes , ” which we always imagine to be both brilliant and tranquil .

#Text=The doors and windows of the large square house were all wide open , to admit the purifying sunshine , which lay in generous patches upon the floor of a wide , high , covered piazza adjusted to two sides of the mansion -- a piazza on which several straw-bottomed rocking-chairs and half a dozen of those small cylindrical stools in green and blue porcelain , which suggest an affiliation between the residents and the Eastern trade , were symmetrically disposed .

#Text=It was an ancient house -- ancient in the sense of being eighty years old ; it was built of wood , painted a clean , clear , faded gray , and adorned along the front , at intervals , with flat wooden pilasters , painted white .

#Text=These pilasters appeared to support a kind of classic pediment , which was decorated in the middle by a large triple window in a boldly carved frame , and in each of its smaller angles by a glazed circular aperture .

#Text=A large white door , furnished with a highly-polished brass knocker , presented itself to the rural-looking road , with which it was connected by a spacious pathway , paved with worn and cracked , but very clean , bricks .

#Text=Behind it there were meadows and orchards , a barn and a pond ; and facing it , a short distance along the road , on the opposite side , stood a smaller house , painted white , with external shutters painted green , a little garden on one hand and an orchard on the other .
#Text=All this was shining in the morning air , through which the simple details of the picture addressed themselves to the eye as distinctly as the items of a “ sum ” in addition .
#Text=A second young lady presently came out of the house , across the piazza , descended into the garden and approached the young girl of whom I have spoken .
#Text=This second young lady was also thin and pale ; but she was older than the other ; she was shorter ; she had dark , smooth hair .
#Text=Her eyes , unlike the other ’s , were quick and bright ; but they were not at all restless .
#Text=She wore a straw bonnet with white ribbons , and a long , red , India scarf , which , on the front of her dress , reached to her feet .
#Text=In her hand she carried a little key .
#Text=“ Gertrude , ” she said , “ are you very sure you had better not go to church ? ”
#Text=Gertrude looked at her a moment , plucked a small sprig from a lilac-bush , smelled it and threw it away .
#Text=“ I am not very sure of anything ! ” she answered .
#Text=The other young lady looked straight past her , at the distant pond , which lay shining between the long banks of fir trees .
#Text=Then she said in a very soft voice , “ This is the key of the dining-room closet .
#Text=I think you had better have it , if anyone should want anything . ”
#Text=“ Who is there to want anything ? ” Gertrude demanded .
#Text=“ I shall be all alone in the house . ”
#Text=“ Someone may come , ” said her companion .
#Text=“ Do you mean Mr. Brand ? ”
#Text=“ Yes , Gertrude .
#Text=He may like a piece of cake . ”
#Text=“ I do n’t like men that are always eating cake ! ”
#Text=Gertrude declared , giving a pull at the lilac-bush .
#Text=Her companion glanced at her , and then looked down on the ground .
#Text=“ I think father expected you would come to church , ” she said .
#Text=“ What shall I say to him ? ”
#Text=“ Say I have a bad headache . ”
#Text=“ Would that be true ? ” asked the elder lady , looking straight at the pond again .
#Text=“ No , Charlotte , ” said the younger one simply .
#Text=Charlotte transferred her quiet eyes to her companion ’s face . “ I am afraid you are feeling restless . ”
#Text=“ I am feeling as I always feel , ” Gertrude replied , in the same tone .
#Text=Charlotte turned away ; but she stood there a moment .
#Text=Presently she looked down at the front of her dress .
#Text=“ Does n’t it seem to you , somehow , as if my scarf were too long ? ” she asked .
#Text=Gertrude walked half round her , looking at the scarf .
#Text=“ I do n’t think you wear it right , ” she said .
